title: You Soared Afar With Grace
statementHtml:
You are given a permutation aa and bb of length nn∗∗. You can perform the following operation at most nn times:

Determine whether aa and bb can be reverses of each other after operations. In other words, for each i=1,2,…,ni=1,2,…,n, ai=bn+1−iai=bn+1−i.

If it is possible, output any valid sequence of operations. Otherwise, output −1−1.

∗∗A permutation of length nn is an array consisting of nn distinct integers from 11 to nn in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4][2,3,1,5,4] is a permutation, but [1,2,2][1,2,2] is not a permutation (22 appears twice in the array), and [1,3,4][1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3n=3 but there is 44 in the array).
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer nn (2≤n≤2⋅1052≤n≤2⋅105) — the length of the permutations.

The second line contains nn integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an (1≤ai≤n1≤ai≤n).

The third line contains nn integers b1,b2,…,bnb1,b2,…,bn (1≤bi≤n1≤bi≤n).

It is guaranteed that aa and bb are permutations of length nn.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, if it is impossible, output −1−1 in the only line. Otherwise, output a single integer mm (0≤m≤n0≤m≤n) — the number of operations in the first line. In the following mm lines, output two integers — the indices ii and jj (1≤i,j≤n1≤i,j≤n, i≠ji≠j) in each operation in order. If there are multiple solutions, print any of them.
noteHtml:
In the second test case, bb is already the reverse of aa.

In the third test case, after performing the following operation, bb will become the reverse of aa:

  • Swap a1,a2a1,a2 and swap b1,b2b1,b2. Now a=[3,1,2,4]a=[3,1,2,4] and b=[4,2,1,3]b=[4,2,1,3].

In the fourth test case, after performing the following operations in order, bb will become the reverse of aa:

  • Swap a1,a2a1,a2 and swap b1,b2b1,b2. Now a=[5,2,1,3,4]a=[5,2,1,3,4] and b=[5,3,4,2,1]b=[5,3,4,2,1].
  • Swap a1,a3a1,a3 and swap b1,b3b1,b3. Now a=[1,2,5,3,4]a=[1,2,5,3,4] and b=[4,3,5,2,1]b=[4,3,5,2,1].
